alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 2:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH WILL EXPIRE AT 3 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... The Flood Watch will expire for a portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, South Central Mountains. The flooding threat for early this morning has ended. Therefore, the Flood Watch will expire at 3 AM MDT early this morning. && ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible again this afternoon. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following area, South Central Mountains. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Abnormally high moisture has entered southern New Mexico. This will lead to numerous showers and thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rainfall rates which may lead to excessive runoff. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
